newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's Bradesco Previdencia Q1 rvs jump 45 pct.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's Bradesco Previdencia Q1 rvs jump 45 pct.

text.p: Brazil's largest pension plan firm Bradesco Previdencia said revenues jumped 45 percent to 126 million reais ($118.9 million) in the first quarter of 1997 compared to the same period of 1996.
In a statement, Bradesco Previdencia, a unit of Brazil's largest private bank Bradesco, said its investment portfolio rose 35 percent in March to 2.8 billion reais against March 1996.
The first quarter results stemmed from a rise in contracts with companies to provide pension plans for employees, it said.

Bradesco Previdencia said private pension plans became a promising market in Brazil after the government slashed inflation and granted tax exemptions on private pension plan investments under the terms of a pension reform bill.

In addition, Brazilians are aware that benefits provided by the government after the pension reform will be limited to a certain amount, so they will need a complementary private pension plan, it said.
Currently, Bradesco Previdencia provides pension plans to 7,000 companies.
